Additional XPath Data 2:
ALBINA VEREDUNA
 ra17
White-fleshed, original variety with a sweet and spicy taste. Leaves can be cooked like spinach for eating. Suitable for keeping after the leaves have wilted. Due to a lack of the dye betanin, hands and kitchen stay clean.
Colour: white

Additional XPath Data 2:
ANGELA SG
ra10
Evenly shaped, round, beetroot with a smooth skin and a sweet taste. The fruit and skin are uniformly purple in color. Very suitable for storage.
Colour: red

BULL'S BLOOD
ra80
Very old beetroot variety from the Netherlands with an intense red color. Leaves harvested young are good for salads.
Colour: red

Additional XPath Data 2:
CHIOGGIA
 ra15
Interesting, traditional variety from Italy. Outside bright light-red. Inside alternating red and white layers. Particularly suited for salads. Layers lose definition during cooking.
Colour: red-white

GESCHE SG
  ra11
High-yield and homogeneous organic variety by Saat:gut from Northern Germany with dark-red, round beets. Suitable for storage but can also be harvested as beet greens.
Colour: red

Explanations
Bioverita: This variety is an organic, newly bred, variety. It has been cultivated from the very outset in organic conditions, to best adapt to organic cultivation. Varieties that carry the Bioverita label are reproducible and fertile, and aim to offer an alternative to hybrid-seeds to professional gardeners.
Precision seeds: The seeds are calibrated and have an increased germination capacity. The seeds are sold per piece.
Seed tape (portion content: 1 seed tape of 5m): This item is available in a special form for simple gardening. Here the seeds are fixed at appropriate distances between two thin pieces of carrier paper. To sow, this is then buried directly in the ground. The annoying job of separating or pricking out seedlings is no longer necessary. Whatever the variety, there are models for balcony planters, pots, or a row seeder.

WINTERSONNE SG

Ã„GYPTISCHE PLATTRUNDE
